repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collection documents the day-to-day activities of Holding Our Own, an organization established to incite and support feminist social justice in New York's Capital Region.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed in 2024 by Maggie Zehr.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.
The Department of Special Collections and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by Carmen Rau in 2016.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Established in 1982 and existing for nearly four decades, Holding Our Own supported feminist social justice. A multiracial, multicultural philanthropic foundation led by women of color, Holding Our Own, Inc. awarded grants to organizations and projects in New York's Capital Region which benefitted women. Special attention was given to grassroots organizations and those which represented women who faced bias or had limited access to traditional funding sources. This included funding of reading groups for children of color, a recreation project for women with AIDS/HIV, carpentry training for battered women, and a cooperative tutoring project involving a public housing tenant group and a local college. Holding Our Own also partnered with the Women's Building Project to fund and provide access to services and programs improving the quality of life for women and girls in the Albany area. When choosing organizations and programs to fund, Holding Our Own prioritized intersectional projects that served all women regardless of race, sexuality, age, ability, ethnicity, religion, education or class.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains meeting minutes, grant materials, award ceremony files, subject files, conference materials, administrative records, project reports, and other administrative files.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Holding Our Own Records, 1981-2010. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Holding Our Own Records).
